abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Sector Adjustment Credit
            (PSAC) is an integral part of the Bank Strategy, set forth
            in the Country Assistance Strategy (CAS) for Senegal (2003).
            The objective of the Project is to support the Government in
            the implementation of sub-sector reforms aimed at improving
            the investment climate, and accelerating private sector
            growth, and employment. The PSAC supports the
            Government's Poverty Reduction Strategy through
            improvements within the investment climate, and
            implementation of key sector reforms. The first tranche was
            disbursed upon effectiveness. The conditions of release of
            the floating tranche as listed in the Development Credit
            Agreement between the Borrower and the International
            Development Association (IDA) related to the Tax Reform
            Plan, state the conditions that need to be fulfilled.
            Therefore, in view of the overall performance and progress
            with the implementation of the Tax Reform Plan supported by
            the Credit, and in compliance with the specific conditions
            of release, the Association has informed the Borrower of the
            availability of the tax reform floating tranche, in the
            amount of SDR 4.7 million.
